title: Calculate a Basic Set of Time-Series Properties
text: Users can compute features basicproperties using main function get_properties. can run one-liner takes input vector argument. demonstration vector T = 1000 samples generated AR(1) process:
code: library(basicproperties) y <- arima.sim(model = list(ar = 0.8), n = 1000) outs <- get_properties(y) outs feature_name        values 1               mean  8.146526e-02 2             median  1.432727e-01 3               mode            NA 4                min -4.941497e+00 5                max  4.474004e+00 6           skewness -1.442257e-01 7           kurtosis -2.945387e-01 8              acf_1  8.091851e-01 9              acf_2  6.598851e-01 10             acf_3  5.237733e-01 11             acf_4  4.141441e-01 12             acf_5  3.354786e-01 13               IQR  2.367473e+00 14                sd  1.688698e+00 15      linear_trend  5.169243e-04 16 spectral_centroid  4.998506e+02 17    prop_above_3SD  0.000000e+00 18        quantile_5 -2.810577e+00 19       quantile_25 -1.120734e+00 20       quantile_75  1.246739e+00 21       quantile_95  2.716110e+00
